sections.title: Case Studies and Applications
topics: Industry-Specific AI Applications (e.g., healthcare, finance, transportation)

subsections.title: Foundations of AI Governance
topics: Understanding AI systems as socio-technical systems
Use of frameworks like the OECD for AI classification and governance
The role of AI in society: risks and benefits (recognition, personalization, optimization)

subsections.title: Responsible AI and Risk Management
topics: Principles of Trustworthy AI: Human-centric, Safe, secure, and resilient, Transparent and explainable, Privacy-enhanced, Fair and non-discriminatory

Managing AI Risks: Identifying individual and societal risks (e.g., civil rights, economic opportunity, reputation), Mitigating algorithmic bias, ensuring fairness and accountability, Auditing and continuous monitoring of AI systems

subsections.title: AI Laws and Compliance
topics: Global AI Laws: EU AI Act: Classification (prohibited, high-risk, limited risk, low risk), Canada's Bill C-27 (Artificial Intelligence and Data Act), US State AI Laws, Chinaâ€™s Generative AI Regulations
GDPR and AI Intersection: Automated decision-making and transparency, Data protection impact assessments (DPIA) and conformity assessments, Individual rights (meaningful information on AI decisions)

subsections.title: Emerging AI Governance Frameworks
topics: Council of Europe Human Rights Framework for AI

subsections.title: AI Development Life Cycle Governance
topics: Planning: Align AI projects with business objectives, governance structures, and risk assessments
Design: Data strategy (gathering, cleansing, applying PETs like differential privacy)
Development: Model training, testing, and validation with a focus on fairness, privacy, and safety
Implementation: Deployment, monitoring, and maintenance of AI systems, ensuring post-launch compliance

subsections.title: Ongoing Legal and Ethical Issues
topics: AI Liability: Understanding tort liability, developer vs. user responsibility
Intellectual Property (IP): Addressing challenges with AI model and data licensing
User Education: Ensuring transparency in AI capabilities, upskilling the workforce
Audit and Accountability: Building a global profession for AI auditors, enhancing accountability in sensitive AI applications

subsections.title: International Organizations
topics: European Union (EU): Implements the EU AI Act
United Nations Educational, Scientific and Cultural Organization (UNESCO): Promotes ethical AI guidelines
Council of Europe: Works on human rights-based AI frameworks

subsections.title: National Initiatives
topics: White House Office of Science and Technology Policy: AI Bill of Rights in the USA
Canada: Bill C-27 (Artificial Intelligence and Data Act)
Cyberspace Administration of China: Generative AI regulations

subsections.title: Standards Bodies
topics: IEEE: Developing ethical AI standards (e.g., IEEE 7000)
ISO: Risk management and safety standards (e.g., ISO 31000)
